p: Hydroxyapatite inorganic components (Ca 10(PO 4) 6(OH) 2) resemble, in the most favorable way, the natural biological apatite found in bone. Therefore, it is of interest in medicine and biomedical engineering for bone regeneration and dental applications. As a result of its biocompatibility, hydroxyapatite can be used for coating metal prostheses or dental implants, which is favorable for a successful osteointegration process. On the other hand, it is well known that the risk of postoperative infections [ 2, 3, 4] can be drastically reduced by incorporating antibacterial agents in the chemical structure of hydroxyapatite.
